questions.questionText: "For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life." Where is this verse found?
questions.explanation: This is one of the most well-known verses in the Bible, often called 'the Gospel in a nutshell.'

questions.questionText: "The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want." Which book contains this verse?
questions.explanation: Psalm 23 is one of the most beloved passages in Scripture, written by David.

questions.questionText: What comes immediately after 'In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth'?
questions.correctAnswer: The earth was without form and void
incorrectAnswers: And God said, 'Let there be light'
And the Spirit of God was hovering
And God saw that it was good
questions.explanation: Genesis 1:2 describes the initial state of creation before God began to form and fill it.

questions.questionText: The Greek word 'logos' (λόγος) translated as 'Word' in John 1:1 also appears in which of these passages?
questions.correctAnswer: Revelation 19:13 - 'His name is called The Word of God'
incorrectAnswers: Matthew 5:17 - 'Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law'
2 Timothy 3:16 - 'All Scripture is breathed out by God'
questions.explanation: Logos (G3056) is used as a title for Christ in both John 1:1 and Revelation 19:13.
